website_summaries.verdict: The KEEN Arroyo II is a reasonably priced, comfortable hiking sandal that greatly impressed users with its durability and versatility. It’s a grippy footwear that holds its ground on different types of surfaces. It is also easy to clean and dry. Preferred orthotics by wearers also fit the interior pretty nicely.There were, however, users that came away dissatisfied with the sandal’s lack of steadiness due primarily to its elastic laces. Further compounding the negativity that surrounds the Arroyo II are the sandal’s underperformance against debris.
pros: The KEEN Arroyo II got excellent remarks from satisfied owners for its sturdy build
Many owners loved the sandal’s reasonable price tag
Quite a number of people, including an expert reviewer, adored the sandal for its versatility
They said that it isn’t just for outdoor adventures, but also for casual use
In terms of comfort, many users were truly impressed with the second edition of the KEEN Arroyo
This sandal is easy to clean, according to a handful of owners
A few of them even said it’s washer-friendly
A moderate percentage of KEEN Arroyo II’s user base lauded its grippy outsole which maintains great traction on most surfaces
A handful of wearers were pleased with the Arroyo II’s quick-drying upper
A few customers praised the sandal for its ability to accommodate their custom orthotics well
They said that insoles of their preference lock in place pretty snugly
cons: A number of disappointed users were annoyed because they couldn’t shake off the debris while wearing the sandal
A few female buyers protested about its lack of color variation
Apparently, one color—dull brown, according to an owner—simply is appalling
A few owners weren’t too thrilled about the sandal’s lacing system
One of them said that the lace clips struggled to keep their grip and had to be adjusted numerous times
One expert expressed his discontent with the elastic laces
He said that the Arroyo II lacks steadiness because of them

customer_reviews.title: painful
customer_reviews.text: I badly want to like these since they look so cool and sturdy. I’ve had them for a couple years and have hiked through rivers and wet canyons. They STILL are not broken in. I have to wear medical tape around my feet they’re so painful, and I have permanent scars from where they’ve dug into all the bones on the sides of my feet (ankles and toes). And once sand gets in there—forget it. It never comes out, just works its way deeper into your cuts. I’m keeping these until I’m old enough to get away with wearing socks under them.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Great in most respects
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these sandals daily for years and have never seen a need to try anything else. They fit as you would expect and are comfortable to wear all day long. The one drawback to these sandals, and it's been true of every pair I've owned, is that the glued-on components (mostly of the soles) come loose and always at the wrong time. I've found that the best thing to use to reattach then is contact cement, but for a product this expensive this shouldn't be necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Murray in Costa Rica

customer_reviews.title: STINKY
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing other brand shoes for 25+ YEARS and never had this problem before. The material on the inside holds moisture and they smelled HORRIBLE after wearing them 2 times. I'm going back to my old brand. I'm sad because they were really comfortable and offered great support, but if you are going to expose them to water I would avoid.
customer_reviews.author: John Cichowski

customer_reviews.title: Sweaty Hot
customer_reviews.text: The material of these shoes is not good for water. So I get them wet, the next day the smell was horrific. My feet usually are not soaking wet from sweat but in these shoes I stay sweaty which means smell. This is a very hot shoe. Might be great for other people, but not for me. I buy a new pair of Keens every spring. I am a boat house builder. Some of there shoes are great for what I do and this one is not.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy E Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: A light Keen that could...
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected of Keen... The sole "fingers" started peeling off on the right side of the right shoe after only 4 months since purchase and perhaps three solid weeks of hiking. Actually, more like two and a half. Anyways, I have a lot of Keen pairs, and this one's the first one to do this. I submitted a claim with Keen for the first time ever, lets see what happens. Other than that, the fit is phenomenal and protection is superb...
customer_reviews.author: sunguardian

customer_reviews.title: Keens Arroyo II are My Favorite Go-To Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple pairs of Keens Arroyo II shoes. I have them in different colors. They fit my feet, I am 6ft, about 240lbs, and have size 9.5 feet with somewhat high arch. These shoes come in only MEDIUM width so if you have WIDE feet you might not like them. They are rugged, I have worn out at least 3 pair over the last 15 years. They keep your feet cool in the desert heat and where I live they are warm enough in the winter months. I wear them with ankle socks but they can be worn with no socks in the water.
customer_reviews.author: ScottieLV

customer_reviews.title: Unmatched comfort & durability
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pair of keens in Tucson Arizona in 17 and I can honestly say that they are worn almost everyday. Durability is a whole nother level of tough. From fishing to hiking and just everyday use these keens, are the GOAT. You might be able to buy a more rugged piece of footwear but you will never be as comfortable and durable as a keen.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Toland

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE the WORST, DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: The sole in these shoes fell apart in a matter of a month. And the stink, oh my goodness, the stink. It is unbearable. I thought an animal died , but alas it was these shoes. Only owned for ONE year and they are awful and horrible and i will not get this style of Keen Ever EVER again and i recommend you do not either. There are other keens i would recommend. Those with antimicrobial. I have had mine for over a decade and they are amazing, this style is just a dude and i do not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: J. Beeman

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I already have a pair of Keen sandals that I love, so I bought these for my husband to try. He's pretty picky about footwear and was skeptical about these, but once he tried them on and wore them for a couple days, he was hooked; he LOVES them. He said they're very comfortable, have good support and -- bonus -- they look great too. He's very hard on sandals though, so time will tell how well these will hold up. I've had mine for a couple years now and they've held up well, so hopefully his will too.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S.

customer_reviews.title: I wish they were a little wider, or had size options that allowed specifying width
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I love Keen products. My current Keen sandals have lasted for 10 years, and are still good (though no tread left!). However, these particular Arroyo II are a little on the narrow side for my feet, so pinch a little. Perhaps that will change over time, and they will stretch laterally. However, at present, they are a little too tight. It would be nice if they offered multiple width sizes, so that those with wide feet could find the ideal size.
customer_reviews.author: Quilpole

customer_reviews.title: Horrible stink after just 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: After just 2 months of daily wear, including some moderate hiking and occasional lake and river dips, the smell of these sandals was unbearable. My running shoes never stink anywhere near this bad, even after hundreds of miles of sweat and mud. Tried spraying, washing them and running them through the washing machine to no avail. I can’t keep them in the house and won’t wear them anymore in public because they stink so bad. I like the look and feel of these sandals so it’s incredibly disappointing that I’ll be throwing them out after just 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Ross

customer_reviews.title: Keen Quality short again
customer_reviews.text: Love the fit and comfort, cannot believe the short coming quality and durability. Although I purchased these in October and only wore them occasionally, the premature wear of all upper materials is utterly disappointing...It is sad that the maker cannot achieve the average durability of others brands. I am still wearing my Merrells after two years of heavy use and the souls finally wearing out. The uppers are still full of life. Come on Keen, get it together and be the company you could be.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Martin

customer_reviews.title: Love these, but...
customer_reviews.text: If you are used to wearing another version of Keen sandals (like the Newport), know that these are different in the heels. My heel slips a bit. I still love them and the extra material around my heel makes this more like a shoe than a sandal so sand and rocks, etc., aren't quite as likely to slip inside. I love this product as I have other Keen footwear but there is definitely a different fit in the heel. Maybe this could be remedied by getting a half size smaller. Not sure about that, though.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Bylsma

customer_reviews.title: Good looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size smaller than normal and had to return it to go even smaller. You have to account for not wearing Sox. If I was making a recommendation I would say someone who wears a 9.5 should order an 8, but good luck. In my opinion shoes are hard to order online. In water the sand and loose rocks get into them and you have to constantly rinse it out.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Reviews can be misleading
customer_reviews.text: The size is okay but I'm struggling getting used to the ties. They don't seem to stay tight for long. In addition, The ties are too long and you have to weave them thru the bands so it doesn't flop around and annoy you. They are very comfortable but my verdict will have to wait especially if I have too re tighten them when I'm doing hiking that requires good support and they keep loosening. The reviews I read did not mention any issues with the strap.
customer_reviews.author: SMcG

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Keen shoes and own a pair myself. However, the men's Arroyo II Sandals have a poor design. My husband's pinky toe popped out once he started walking every time he tried to wear them. We tried one size up and one size down and had the same issue. We had to return them and ended up going to a local store and picking out a new pair of Keen's that were a different style.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals. Be sure the size is right
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking and well made. I have worn size eleven most of my life and ordered that size. It was too small and wore a hole in the top of my second toe. So I went in and got measured and it came out size thirteen. They are very comfortable. I would have exchanged these for a pair of size thirteens but Amazon didn't want to do that. I love Keenes. My last pair is totally shot though. I am afraid I wore them maybe fifteen years and I mean nearly every day.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Leraas

customer_reviews.title: Not a great item
customer_reviews.text: Keen Newport Sandles have changed my life! I live the fit and comfort. When I went to reordering accidently got these. I decided to give them a try. Over the months I've had them I havw almost broken my ankle many times because the solenis too thin. They come with a non elastic cord so they loosen as you hike and you either have to stop frequently to readjust or tie them off. They aren't comfortable and the design is flawed in many ways in my opinion. Stick with Newports!!!
customer_reviews.author: ComicTn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So far, these are great. I haven’t been hiking in them yet but have done lots of walking around the farm in 100 degree weather. They provide excellent support for my wide feet and are even comfortable walking down steep hills. Yesterday I wore them in my wood shop all day while making a cherry dresser. The floor is concrete and I was standing 90% of the time. Usually I wear Crocs for this but the Keena were very comfortable. They look like they will last a long time. The soles have excellent tread, and should be comfortable while hiking on rocky trails.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Kelly

customer_reviews.title: The Keen advisory to opt for a half size larger would be barely adequate
customer_reviews.text: These could be quite comfortable, but NOT if you have a size 12 foot. NO half sizes above child sizes helps no one, it makes buyer find another brand of shoe that will fit. Few want to get a size 13 sandal as that is too much room in sandal. These appear sturdy, but the sweat accumulation in the liner underfoot is not an attribute. Gave to son who only has size 11 feet now. That too will change as he matures.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: If you like the style, get em! Quality, comfort and longevity is there
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband. It’s a repeat purchase... he had the same exact shoe for 5 years and they held up well. He wore them until they had no life left and he was pleased to know this style of keens hasn’t changed at all. The quality and comfort is outstanding. The sizing is exact, they run True to size. I wouldn’t call these wide however my husband will on occasion purchase his shoes in wide depending on the fit. No need for that with these. Just got the ordinary 11.5 and they are wide enough to be comfortable for him.
customer_reviews.author: N-A

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Sandal !
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great fit, comfortable from day one with no break in period. Great lug pattern for rocky terrain, Stiff sole but still flexible. I really love this product. I threw these in the washing machine and came out fresh and clean. Con: After a week wearing them, they had a terrible stink odor and had to put them in a plastic bag before i put them in my luggage for the trip home. Washing machine safe though and after a cleaning they smell good as new!
customer_reviews.author: JERSEYDEVIL

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic shoes. In fact, they are the only sandals that I have found the fit my wide foot without slipping on the heel. Even other Keen's don't fit very well, but these are perfect. They are very comfortable for both hiking and walking on the beach or other water situations. It is very nice to have a pair of shoes that can get wet and still be comfortable for hiking. My only complaint is that the neoprene footbed takes quite a while to dry once it gets wet.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J Connelly

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat these for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the closed heel and breathability of these shoes. With daily wear, I get about a year of use before they need to be replaced. At that point, even if the shoes still look reasonable, the arch support has flattened out and the stretch laces are usually shot. To keep a "backup pair", I carefully remove the old laces from these shoes and use the hardware to install new elastic. Great shoes for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Beauregard

customer_reviews.title: Great sandal, great fit, delivery not so good.
customer_reviews.text: These were ordered as a gift for my husband, and he absolutely loves them. He has a high instep so while they may be loose on someone with a narrow foot, they are perfect for him. Have found other keen's had design change resulting in an uncomfortable fit across the top of his foot. The only complaint I have is that these were ordered the beginning of Mar, received notice that they would arrive about 5 days later (so much for being a prime member), then on the day they were to arrive, I was notified that they were out of stock. Finally received them on Mar 27th - 24 days after the order was placed.
customer_reviews.author: dwis01

customer_reviews.title: Third pair and love them
customer_reviews.text: I wear these every day. I have a really old pair that is covered in paint and I still use them occassionally. Another pair that I wear everyday in my woodworking shop, working in the yard, and all my regular life-stuff as an active, newly retired guy. And a nice pair for wearing out to casual dinners, gatherings in the neighborhood etc. I just love these shoes. And yes, I do add socks in the winter - comfort over style for me. Just saying....
customer_reviews.author: ProfessorTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: A previous quality shoe is now crap!
customer_reviews.text: Keen used to have quality products. My husband’s previous pair of Keen sandals lasted for three years. The specialized ties on this pair broke before one month. The second tie tore within two. Keen said their warranty doesn’t cover the specialized ties. I should have returned them rather than try to deal with their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes especially for water standing on cement floors etc.
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased the keen’s for my son They were too big I have returned them. My son said they look great and he was very happy with them. But they were too big. So I have returned them and I will order another pair in a size 10. He’ll be very excited to get them. I have three pair myself. That’s why I purchased these for my son they are great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Bk

customer_reviews.title: bout this for my dad who loves them
customer_reviews.text: He has wide feet, but these fit fine. One small complaint, the toggle is VERY long so to prevent it flopping around he has to tuck the toggle under the laces to keep it secure, but its such a minor complaint. It replaced a pair he had from Land's End, which he felt were a lot less comfortable than these.
customer_reviews.author: Mstorm

customer_reviews.title: I love these things!
customer_reviews.text: I wear these everywhere. They are tough enough to wear into the wilderness hiking and then with a little leather cleaner you can wear them to dinner. I bought a second pair n case they were discontinued 3 years ago but am still wearing the original pair. They slip on easily and provide great support and comfort. I bought my wife a pair and she loves hers too.
customer_reviews.author: Local yokel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but sizing runs large
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for rivers and rocky lakes! Great tread, you can hike comfortably for several miles in these. due to the somewhat open design, some dirt and pebbles make their way in... very comfortable and highly recommended. Be warned, I had to order mine 1 to 1.5 sizes smaller because they are sized larger than other shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Keen Arroyos since 2008 (a few pairs) and each pair has met my expectations as did this pair. I have read negative and glowing reviews, in my case these shoes fit my feet very well, no real break-in needed. I have never had a quality or material issue. I can be a little rough on shoes and these have proven pretty tough. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband who only wears work boots and he loved them. He said he had never wore a shoe with so much padding in the heel. He usually wears a 11.5 EE in work boots and a size 11 in these fit perfect. No complaints of squeezing his foot. He says they are rooming and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: debi wood

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic Except for those Laces
customer_reviews.text: WHY did you ruin a perfectly great shoe with NON-elastic laces (elastic laces were on a previous pair of Keen sandals I previously bought). The shoe is great, easy to put on, comfortable and stylish, but those lousy laces ruin it. Please send all of us a pair of elastic laces for these shoes which would make it a FIVE STAR product easily.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes - excellent fit
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth pair of these shoes that I have owned. They give fantastic support (I have broken both feet and these shoes always give me comfort not found in other shoes, with or without orthodics). I wear them till they are totally shot. Wear size 9-1/2. Used for every day use; walking, hiking, around the house.
customer_reviews.author: M G

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals for hiking and daily use
customer_reviews.text: These are great sandals. I use KEENS for all my footwear (boots, hiking shoes, sandals)--they have the best arch support and room in the toe box area. If you like to wear socks, you may want to go 1/2 size up from your regular size shoe. The sandals have bungee ties to adjust the fit---Great KEENS products!!!
customer_reviews.author: TCS

customer_reviews.title: Great support, order 1/2 size up
customer_reviews.text: My dad loves these! They definitely run a half size too small, as noted in the description. We tried his regular size first and had to exchange them. A half size up fits him perfectly and he loves them. He’s in his late 60s and has knee problems so he always has to wear supportive shoes - in the cooler temps, he’ll wear them around the house as slippers with his socks lol and out and about in the summer without.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Inferior materials and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy shoe that breathes well. I need to wear thick socks with mine for it to lace well but that fine as I get more cushion. They seem like they will hold up well too. UPDATE: Having now worn these for about 9 months I have to say I'm very disappointed in the quality. Both of the soles have had the material separate on them requiring me to glue them back on. This happened while on vacation. I would also not that these have *not* received very hard trail use. I wear them around the house and yard and have only used them a few times on hikes. For the price I was expecting better quality.
customer_reviews.author: CNorris

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes for comfort and good looks. They are great for walking, although not for jogging (for me). I like the way they lace up, but I am always having to adjust the tension a little (not bad), and trying to find a place to tuck the extra shoelace. Overall, a great pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Shoe lacks means of adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Keen has been a top of the line shoe for a long time. I wear a D width shoe but I have a narrow heel. This shoe had excessive slip on my heel that could not be corrected by tightening the laces so I had to return them. Bought a competitor's pair with a velco adjustable heel strap and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: KENNETH GOLUBSKI

customer_reviews.title: wore out 3 pairs ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear the arroyo II keens 300+ days a year in the Seattle area. I wore out 3 pairs. My 3-4 times a week exercise walk is 5+ miles with a 20 lb pack. I use one pair for exercise and one for everyday use. And then cycle the everyday pair to exercise when the exercise pair wears out. My only fear is that Keen will stop making them. Rain? use wool socks. You don't need water proof boots if you are going home to a hot shower (yes, yes, waterproof over the ankle boots are good if you hike in mud. And I have a selection of such boots for mud, snow and 45 lb packs.)
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Rulifson

customer_reviews.title: a little large, but comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've owned Keen's for well over 15 years, and have had at least 10 pairs of various sandals and shoes. Mostly i'm happy, and comfortable, BUT Keen is not consistent with size 13. One pair was at least 2 sizes too large, and the pair of low cut hiking shoes before these is too tight. These Arroyo's are a bit too large, i'm hoping thicker socks will work, there are no half sizes after 11
customer_reviews.author: Divelbiss

customer_reviews.title: I'm keen on these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Awesome... Love keens. Very comfortable. Biggest issue is the laces... They used to be elastic and were easier to tighten. Now they are not. Perhaps they are more durable, but not sure why that matters since the last pair I hadwitg the elastic type. I suspect these will not last as long as my precious pair but perhaps I was spoiled to have had a pair that lasted 4 or 5 years through some pretty rough use. Overall these are really good. I've only had them a couple
customer_reviews.author: Geebs

customer_reviews.title: Love These Sandals
customer_reviews.text: HOWEVER, it seems that Keen is cutting corners. I own five or six pairs of these sandals. The heel height on the most recent pair is lower than my last several. The lining of the whole sandal, but especially the heel, is fabric and wears quickly. All that said, these are the most comfortable "shoe" I've ever worn. Note to prospective buyers: Keen sandals run wide. Not so for Keen hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: AMR

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my picky husband!  He loves them
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my very picky husband........he was worried he wouldn't like them. He LOVED them and wears them a lot..... We hike, boat, canoeing, garden. I have a pair and wear mine all the time, he had said he wanted some but didn't want to pay that much.... I finally convinced him and he is glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Lori B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy good fitting hiking sandal
customer_reviews.text: The info onsite suggested ordering a 1/2 size small. I did and the fit is perfect! I had a pair of Keen sandals somewhat like these that performed less than optimally on a recent hiking trip in Cuba and were getting worn out. The new Arroyo seems very sturdy and, although I haven't worn them much yet, stable, with good traction and grip. The lace draw system seems to work well, again, superior to the earlier model. So far, good. I can update this review in a couple of months after I get some walking, hiking miles on the sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank you AMAZON!
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with my purchase. I noticed my old KEEN sandals that I have had since 2010, were cracking on the footbed and the stitching on the uppers was failing. I didn’t want to be without my KEENS but we are on Quarantine for COVID-19...I am not able to shop for new. Thank you AMAZON! I ordered new KEENs and perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: I like these far better than the one's with the thin strap
customer_reviews.text: Living in the Southeastern U.S., these sandals are worn pretty much year 'round. I used to wear one's that have only the thin strap at the heel, but the strap would break or separate from the sole of the shoe. These are much better without any loss of comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Galyon

customer_reviews.title: Too small - returned and exchanged for full size down
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair - they're well made and durable, and a good compromise between a full shoe and a water sandal. My last pair was pretty much on size - perhaps a touch large. This pair was way too big. I wear a 12 mens for virtually every shoe I wear for many years. This is the first time I had to return and opted to exchange for a size 11.
customer_reviews.author: MontanaClan

customer_reviews.title: not what I've come to expect from Keen.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I've worn the Arroyo's; I'm not impressed. They fit comfortably but they don't seem as durable as older Keens I've owned. The cord snugging the sandal up isn't elastic, but rather regular cord that doesn't stretch. The tongue isn't attached the same way other models are and there's a noticeable tendency for it to tuck under the sides of the sandal as you're pulling it on. Because of the fit and poor quality I'm going to exchange it for another model and hope I'm happier with it. I have heard, however, that once Keen went public with their stock the quality of the footwear has suffered.
customer_reviews.author: Tod Poirier

customer_reviews.title: Watch the sizing
customer_reviews.text: Great sandals. The closed heel prevents most of those little rocks from getting flipped up and under your foot so that you have to remove the sandal to get rid of the rock. I've owned several pairs of Keens, both shoes and sandals, and will buy more, I'm sure. Good construction, long lasting. A word of caution though. All Keens run large on me. I wear a size 10 in every other shoe brand, but I have to drop to a 9.5 when buying Keens.
customer_reviews.author: Kili19341

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband...after reading the reviews I decided to order a half size smaller and he was very pleased with them...he wore them for a full day and he said they did not give him blisters so over all pleased with the purchase. Keens are a different fitting shoe if you have never wore them before go to a store and try them on before ordering online.
customer_reviews.author: AudreyS

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking sandal if you need orthotics.
customer_reviews.text: Orthotic friendly! Comfortable. I really do love these shoes. The removable foot bed allows me to insert my 3/4th length rigid orthotic under the foot bed. This is working great for me. Was not sure I could use a hiking sandal but this model allows me to use my orthotic. I like the ventilation. Shoe is very stable without feeling confining or tight. Wearing them most of the time unless I need muck boots, seriously supportive field boots or something dressy. I have seriously bad feet (crushing injury in car wreck, multiple surgeries) and my feet are different sizes and shapes. The design and lacing system seem pretty forgiving of size variation and pressure points. Highly recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are my daily footwear once spring arrives. I wear them like shoes (with socks) to do everything. They're easy on and off and very comfortable. They're stiff and tight on arrival but quickly break in to fit my wife feet and high arches. I've worn them for years and hope they stay on the market
customer_reviews.author: Brien

customer_reviews.title: Good except insoles
customer_reviews.text: I first saw these in a store where I live. I looked online and they are $30 cheaper here on Amazon so right there is a plus. They fit very comfortably except the insole. I'd suggest taking the insole it comes with, out, and replacing it. I actually put a cheapo Walmart insole in there and now the shoes are perfect. I've only hiked in them for two weeks or so but I will update later on to see how quick they deteriorate.
customer_reviews.author: T.P

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for some light hiking and some support for my feet. The shoes are very comfortable and wear great! the heel area does warrant concern as the material does not appear to be very heavy duty or durable. However, after two months of moderate hiking and daily wear, they seem to be doing great. I do allow some extra attention when putting them on (as a precaution) to be gentle to the heel strap. And s far, no issues. I am very happy with the product so far, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Slippery on wet pavement!
customer_reviews.text: Beware! Slippery on wet pavement! I have a number of Keen work boots with the same sole (at least it looks the same) which have very good traction on dry and wet. Fit and traction are why I like the Keen brand. But these are slippery on wet or damp pavement! Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Dale G

customer_reviews.title: Great, but get 1/2 size smaller.
customer_reviews.text: Without repeating the other's comments; I can say that I'm very happy with this sandalish hiker shoe. Very comfortable, good support, easy lacing, quality materials, and good looking too. Maybe because of its open design, it feels a little large on the feet. Especially if you're planning to use them without socks, definitely get it 1/2 size smaller. I'm only wearing them with socks for this reason (too late to return). Amazon's page states that this shoe fits "as expected", which is totally wrong. Even the manufacturer's site mentions that it's fits somewhat larger then its intended size (but I didn't see it before I ordered it).
customer_reviews.author: J. Dauntless

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to wear all day!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes/sandals. They are very comfortable and durable. I am walking most of the day and at the end of the day, my feet and legs are fine. Highly recommend. Even more comfortable with socks but I can only get away with socks when my wife isn't around!
customer_reviews.author: Mary H.

customer_reviews.title: Another great Keen shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fit is good. . .I believe they run a bit small as I went for a 12 when in most shoes an 11 - 11.5 fits best. I'm glad I ordered the 12s. Very comfortable and I've already put a lot of miles on the - including all over NYC on vacation when they were brand new. No break in needed and they're my 'travel shoes' for flights and drives as well.
customer_reviews.author: PopaJoe

customer_reviews.title: More shoe than Sandal
customer_reviews.text: These look great online yet on arrival they are more shoe than sandal. They are fewer drainage slots due to enclosed heel, and side slots are also less open. Based on feedback from others i will go with H2 as i dont want rocks/sand being trapped
customer_reviews.author: HOT in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Several reviews said they ran large but I ordered my ...
customer_reviews.text: Several reviews said they ran large but I ordered my usual size and they fit. I compared them to my other shoes of the same size and they were the same size. The toe box has some room for my wide feet. It the first shoe I ever purchased where the height of the shoe hugs your feet in the toe box. The soles are okay but a little on the soft side so they may not hold up compared to more durable soles.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ciavarella

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband love them!!! I bought for our trip to Cancun and we walk through all the natural and archeological parks for several days and he didn't complain about pain in his feet or legs as he always does. Shoes still looked like new after sand, rain, salt water and sun exposure.
customer_reviews.author: Betsey0910

customer_reviews.title: Way too big, at least a size bigger than other Keens of same nominal size
customer_reviews.text: Bought these and another pair of similar Keens (Newport H2) to replace old pair of Keens. All were nominal size 11.5. These were a good size larger than either of the other two pairs.
customer_reviews.author: ShoreDame

customer_reviews.title: Alright Alright Alright!
customer_reviews.text: I just didy first creek hike in these and man, they held their own like a champ! Couldn't ask for a better product! I'll update at the end of summer on their durability, but I doubt there will ne any issues there. These are Keens after all!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE KEEN SHOES
customer_reviews.text: I have three pair of these Keen Arroyo II Shoes. I wear them all the time where I live , summer and winter in Vegas. They keep my feet cool and they fit my feet perfectly and protect my toes.
customer_reviews.author: ScottieLV

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandals
customer_reviews.text: My husband always takes size 10. But I read reviews and recommendations on the internet from various sources, and read where a half size smaller was recommended if no thick socks , or any socks were going to be worn with them. I ordered a 9.5 size, and they are truly perfect for my husband who normally takes size 10. He loves them. He has normal feet and can wear them for hours. We have other KEEN footwear. My advice is to research for each item, to see if a half size bigger or smaller is needed, depending on the style. These sandals are perfect, comfortable and look really manly, but should be half size smaller than your normal size.
customer_reviews.author: SEATTLE DOG LOVER

customer_reviews.title: Sorry to See Keen Phasing Out This Model
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite Keen shoe model. The covered toe box and a firm, cushioned sole make it suitable for a wide range of three-season uses from recreational walking to yard work. Unfortunately, Keen appears to be discontinuing it in favor of another model with a less supportive sole and too much flex in it to suit me. I bought two pairs of the Arroyo II with the hope that Keen will reintroduce it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Rick E.

customer_reviews.title: Slightly large but fantastic shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Just love these. I wear 11 but these run a quarter size or so large. The grip and support is fantastic. Took these on a couple backpacking trips to use as camp shoes and ended up using the as day hikers on a couple shorter day trips. Great shoe/sandal.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth P.

customer_reviews.title: A VERY comfortable worthwhile investment for years to come!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these sandals for myself as my size was not available in the women's Arroyo II sandal. Both the men's and women's Arroyo II sandal are identical. It seems that the toe box is just a bit wider in the men's sandal, which is great because of my orthotics. They are extremely comfortable and I look forward to wearing them for several years from now. Keen shoes and sandals last me anywhere from at least 8-10 years. They are most definitely a worthwhile investment.
customer_reviews.author: DottyB.

customer_reviews.title: Working great for me
customer_reviews.text: These sandal/shoes work great. Though I'm wondering if they aren't made to be worn with socks as they were rough on the top of my toes till I learned to lace the bottom eyelets looser than the top.
customer_reviews.author: bert

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves these
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes. He wore them on our honeymoon to Bermuda where we spent a lot of time hiking, touring a jungle, touring caves, and spending plenty of time at the beach. These held up to everything without giving him blisters. His pinky toe would sometimes peek out of the hole on the side, but nothing significant enough to cause blisters or discomfort. We put these to the test and they passed!
customer_reviews.author: AmznUser181921

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair after stitching came lose in the 1st pair and stabbed/infeted my toes on my left foot. I like them better than the sandals because they don't capture as much sand/gravel/weeds when hiking.
customer_reviews.author: annabelle

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Keens that I have been wearing for over 8 years (and am still wearing them). This pair is an update to that pair of shoes. They are so comfortable and versatile. I decided to choose something with a closed heel so that I can walk in sand and water while minimizing rocks and debris from entering the heel area. These look great in a semi-formal environment, but are also great for the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew William

customer_reviews.text: Ordered this when it was on sale for my dad because I love this company and wanted to introduce him to it. He finally got to wear it over the summer and a part of the glue or something is peeling off. I'm so embarrassed and disappointed--love Keen and I was not expecting this!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa K

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite things
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I wore through the first pair cuz I wore them all the time. Only disappointment was that the price had increased from $60 a pair to $90 a pair. So, I tried a cheaper brand from Lands End. Quality not even close! LE material shape caused blisters on my ankle and material was hard and uncomfortable. KEEN is still worth the money
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Unique Sandal
customer_reviews.text: These sandals have a removable footbed, which means I can substitute my Superfeet insoles. No more foot pain after an hour or so on my feet! There may be other similar sandals with this feature, but I have not found them. Of course my feet get hot in summer if I don't wear socks, although the ventilation does help a bit. The solution -- wear socks if it's really hot -- at least if your style sense will allow you to do that. The Arroyo II is (for me) the perfect hiking/walking the dog/knocking around sandal. I'm going to buy another pair before they change it or stop making it.
customer_reviews.author: Mahatma Head

customer_reviews.title: No Bungee, but Excellent Overall
customer_reviews.text: The reviews about there being no bungee laces are accurate. However, this is an amazing shoe that has helped me to live with chronic foot pain. (Plantar fasciitis). I just bought a set of Lock Laces and all is well. I feel like the shoe is actually helping my feet heal.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M.

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable and Cooler Feet.
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of these I've purchased. These are hands-down, my fave shoe for work due to the air vents. My feet don't overheat like they used to when wearing dress shoes and / or other closed types of shoes. I've been buying KEEN shoes for years and years. They're about the only thing that fits my feet and are not fatiguing. These however, didn't hold up well. They do wear out quickly. The first pair wore out at the orange areas as well as the laces. The soles however, held up just fine over the years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M.

customer_reviews.title: A great shoe that helps keep your feet cooler
customer_reviews.text: I got this shoe because my feet tend to get hot, especially in the summer. These shoes provide a lot more ventilation, even when wearing socks. Unless it's raining or I need something a little more formal, these are my "go to" shoes.
customer_reviews.author: CSM1966

customer_reviews.title: These are great for protecting your toes and heel while keeping them ...
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second pair in 2+ years! I beat the hell out of them - they are very durable. I could still be on my first pair if I didn't care how ratty they looked! These are great for protecting your toes and heel while keeping them cooler in the summer. Combine these with a nice breathable sock. My only real complaint is that I always break the laces on them after a while (months). I replace the laces with 550 paracord and they are good to go!
customer_reviews.author: PEE CEE

customer_reviews.title: A good shoe, I hope they are never discontinued!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband after he wore out his last pair. He really likes them! Worn with pants and dark socks, they work well as casual shoes. Worn with no socks, they are great sandals. He hikes the local trails; the closed toe and heel prevent injury and slipping out of the footbed, but still has all the cool/non-sweaty features of a sandal.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalie Marley

customer_reviews.title: Great look and feel - but lacing system seems defective
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear size 11 shoe, and these seem to run a little large. The larger size wouldn't be an issues however, if the lacing system was working better. The device that stops the laces from moving around doesn't seem to hold very long. I went on one medium-level hike and I found myself constantly tightening my laces the entire time. I like the shoes but unfortunately I can't hike with shoes that don't hold the laces so I will need to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Gafvert

customer_reviews.title: This is a very comfortable sandal with an aggressive tread not normally seen on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable sandal with an aggressive tread not normally seen on sandals, that makes it perfect for hiking. I normally wear a size 13 but found the 12 to fit better. My only complaint is that they are a little hotter than my other Keen sandals due to the thick leather sides, but I expect these will hold up for a long time because of the material, so it's also a positive.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Barrie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed: Quality and Fit
customer_reviews.text: Not the same quality as the Keens I’ve been wearing for the last 8 years, which are still serviceable. The leather is of a poor quality, the fit is loose, and the laces are garbage. Really, not worth $90. Regretful purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rover109

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking flowing water trails and everyday use!
customer_reviews.text: I had gotten a pair of these exact Keen's two years ago to hike the Kanarraville Falls creel trail in Utah near Zion NP and have used them for just about everything so that is why I got a second pair. They fit so well and can be used at slip-on around the house I should by 5 more before they discontinue them someday!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Beroldi

customer_reviews.title: A very satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pair of Keens and a pair of Teva Men's Omnium Closed Toe Sandals and I thought I'd return the pair that didn't fit or I didn't like. To my surprise both fit perfectly, and both pairs look great. I've never had shoes that didn't require a little break-in time to feel comfortable. Both pairs are very comfortable. Thanks Keen and Thanks Teva.
customer_reviews.author: maj. easy

customer_reviews.title: Feel like slippers on your feet.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this style of Keen shoes, Arroyo II Sandals, nearly exclusively for about 10 years. They are extremely comfortable right out of the box. They are not hot and wearable for all except the very coldest weather. A pair lasts me for about two years so I have bought several pairs by now. I would be extremely sad if Keen quit selling them. Rick
customer_reviews.author: Richard G

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: 10.5 for 11 ( as the website recommend), It does fit ok,and it cover the foot nicely. For some reason they get the bottom of the foot sweaty, which end up smelling. The design is cool though. Update; had to replace the insert, due to the smell, bought the insert from Keen website.

customer_reviews.title: Right fit everytime!
customer_reviews.text: I have hiked 1600 miles of the AT. Section hiker since 2012. I started the first couple of summers using an assortment of hiking shoes/boots. But when I found the Arroyo II I found the perfect hiking solution. They always fit...no "breaking-in" required. I am on my second pair in the last seven years. I would suggest NOT wearing them on pavement (wear's down the tread) and keep the shoe-strings clean. I will finish in summer 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Moseley

customer_reviews.title: outer sole falling apart
customer_reviews.text: After using it for a week I already seeing a thin line of gap between outer sole and the upper part of the sandals. I don't see any stitches like in other sandals so I'm afraid it will fall apart soon. I don't recommend using this sandals without socks, its already started stinking badly.
customer_reviews.author: Arya

customer_reviews.title: This is a great looking shoe and appeared to be functional as a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking shoe and appeared to be functional as a summer hiking/river shoe. Unfortunately, it felt 6 or 7sizes to large. Every shoe I've ever bought fit my 10.5 size foot. I couldn't adjust these in any way that would prevent me from literary walking out of them when I tried them on. I was flabbergasted. The quality seemed great and I wanted to like them.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a week
customer_reviews.text: One of the lace loops on these broke within a week of having received it, after wearing it only maybe three times, and that was just wearing them around town, not hiking or other challenging circumstances. Amazon did replace the item for me right away, and the replacements have been good so far, but I was disappointed that they broke so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: My 4th Keen footwear.  They have all worked well.
customer_reviews.text: This pair replaced a similar older discontinued model. It fits just as well at the previous and feels as good as expected. It's my 4th pair of Keen footwear (2 pair sandals 2 pair boots) and I like the quality, fit and comfort of all of their products.
customer_reviews.author: JakeTheSnake3141

customer_reviews.title: Looks great..not as comfortable as my newports
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Newports but thought I would go a different direction. They aren't as comfortable as my Newports but look a little better. That being said when I first put the newports on I thought 'meh..they are ok but maybe not worth as much as I paid". But then you find your wearing them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: whobdis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with my purchase. It was exactly as they said true to size. Having a size 14 I was concerned how they would fit and they fit perfectly. I’ve worn them all day long for a couple days now since I’ve gotten them with no blisters or pain or any issues. When they eventually were out I can’t imagine not getting replacements
customer_reviews.author: Kansascitypi

customer_reviews.title: Plantar fasciitis issue
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a Great choice for Summer shoes and to use with my own Custom orthotics. They seem to take the orthotics fine but soon the foot started to hurt again. I believe it has something to do with the curled up front of the sandal which is not recommended with PF condition. Other then that it’s a great sandal
customer_reviews.author: NetBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Really love these, probably won't give much with them because ...
customer_reviews.text: Really love these, probably won't give much with them because I'm picky about getting gravel bits under my feet. I'm sure they'd be great for it because the tred is exactly the same as my Keen Hiking boots. Primary use for me is as a water shoe for boating or just casual summer wear. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. Robino

customer_reviews.title: Excellent footwear!
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'11" 250# and extremely flat footed....excellent fit and support, but my flat feet needed extra help from Dr Scholls arch supports (I need them in every pair of shoes I wear)....purchased these for a recent 3 week trip to Cambodia/Thailand. They performed superbly in extremely hot, humid conditions whether on the town or hiking. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great hiking sandal, needs socks or new insoles
customer_reviews.text: Good sandals so far, though the insoles that they come with are pretty awful if you plan to wear them without socks. I have had them a few months now and am very pleased they show very little sign of wear on the bottom, I put in 10-20k steps daily. If you plan to go sockless though I advised picking up a good odor eating/ breathing insole or your sandals will get a funk pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: smiley

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's Arroyo Ii Hiking Sandals
product_meta.description: All the best features of a hiking shoe and a sandal in one comfortable style. Open Vents in the waterproof leather provide breathability, and the multi-directional lug outsole bites into tough terrain. Technologies: metatomical footbed design; this internal support mechanism is anatomically engineered to provide excellent arch support and cradle the natural contours of the foot. Features: 4mm multi directional lugs; contoured heel lock; secure fit lace capture system; torsion stability ESS shank. Material: water resistant leather upper; non-marking rubber outsole; dual density compression molded eva midsole; hydrophobic mesh lining; removable metatomical dual density eva insoles.
feature_bullets: Performance sport sandal with elastic lacing system and back tab buckle
Removable metatomical EVA double density insole
Hydrophobic mesh lining we hear this style is running on 1/2 large size. We suggest you order a 1/2 size smaller than your usual size.

If you wear your keens daily, they will not always be scuffs and dirt-free. To treat day to day wear and tear, especially on colored leather light, we recommend using a leather cleaner and conditioner, which can be found in most shoe distributors and/or shoe repair shops.
